data.title: Multiplatform games with exclusive content
data.meta_description: Being someone who likes to get the most "complete" version of a game, it's become noteworthy to me to double check multi platform releases for exclusive content.Â  It's a bit of a tiring proc
data.text:
Post by davidpacman on

Being someone who likes to get the most "complete" version of a game, it's become noteworthy to me to double check multi platform releases for exclusive content. It's a bit of a tiring process, since everything is multiplatform nowadays, so I tried to find a list of games that detail this, and came up shorthanded. So I thought, why not create a definitive list together with the HG101 community? I'll start off with everything off the top of my head, and update the list as I discover more information. Anybody that has suggestions can feel free to post, but I would like to set some guidelines:

1) Let's focus on the initial releases. The list will become a bit confusing if we start including ports created later to other platforms. Shovel Knight would be an example of this, which received exclusive bosses on later releases.

2) Timed exclusives are fine, and I'll note that on the list with an *.

Here we go:

Ace Combat 7 (PS4, XBO) - VR mission exclusive to Playstation *timed

Assassin's Creed III (PS3, X360) - The Benedict Arnold Missions are exclusive to Playstation *timed

Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag (PS3, X360, WiiU) - exclusive DLC for Playstation *timed

Batman: Arkham Asylum (PS3, X360) - Joker missions exclusive to Playstation

Batman: Arkham City (PS3, X360) - Sinistro Corps DLC outfit exclusive to Playstation

Batman: Arkham Origins (PC, PS3, X360, WiiU) - Nightfall DLC exclusive to Playstation, Wii U has no multiplayer

Batman: Arkham Knight (PC, PS4, XBO) - Scarecrow DLC exclusive to Playstation

Control (PC, PS4, XBO) - exclusive outfits, mission and mods on Playstation

Cyber Shadow (PC, PS4, PS5, XBO, Switch) - exclusive functionality through Shovel Knight amiibo on Switch

Earthworm Jim (SNES, MD) - Intestinal Distress level exclusive to Mega Drive

Fight Night Round 2 (PS2, GC, Xbox) - Little Mac and Super Punch Out are exclusive to Gamecube

Ghostbusters: The Video Game (PC, PS3, X360) - PC has no online multiplayer

Ghostbusters: The Video Game (PS2, Wii) - offline mutiplayer exclusive to Wii

Marvel vs Capcom Infinite (PC, PS4, XBO) - Major Carol Danvers costume exclusive to Playstation

Marvel's Avengers (PC, PS4, XBO) - Spider-Man exclusive to Playstation

Mega Man X Command Mission (PS2, GC) - exclusive functionality through GBA Link Cable on Gamecube

Mortal Kombat (PS3, X360) - Kratos is exclusive to Playstation

NBA Street V3 (PS2, GC, Xbox) - Mario, Luigi and Peach are exclusive to Gamecube

Rayman Legends (PC, PS3, X360, WiiU) - Mario and Luigi costumes exclusive to Wii U

Resident Evil 7 biohazard (PC, PS4, XBO) - VR mode exclusive to Playstation

Shaq-Fu (SNES, MD) - Mega Drive has five more characters than SNES

Skylanders SuperChargers (PS3, PS4, X360, XBO, WiiU, Wii, 3DS) - Bowser and Donkey Kong are exclusive to Nintendo

Sonic & Sega All-Stars Racing (PC, PS3, X360, Wii, DS) - Banjo-Kazooie and Avatars are exclusive to Xbox, Mii's are exclusive to Wii

Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed (PS3, X360, Wii U) - Miis, minigames, and 5 player multiplayer are exclusive to Wii U, Avatars exclusive to Xbox

Soul Calibur IV (PS3, X360) - Darth Vader is exclusive to PlayStation, Yoda is exclusive to Xbox *timed

Spider-Man (PC, PS2, GC, Xbox) - exclusive missions involving Kraven the Hunter on Xbox

Star Wars Battlefront (PC, PS4, XBO) - VR mission exclusive to Playstation

Starlink: Battle for Atlas (PS4, XBO, Switch) - Starfox characters and scenarios exclusive to Switch

Street Fighter X Tekken (PS3, X360) - 5 characters are exclusive to Playstation

SSX On Tour (PS2, GC, Xbox, PSP) - Mario, Luigi and Peach are exclusive to Gamecube

Tomb Raider: Underworld (PC, PS3, X360, Wii, DS) - Beneath the Ashes and Lara's Shadow DLC exclusive to Xbox

Watch Dogs 2 (PS4, XBO) - All DLC is exclusive on Playstation *timed

Post by Snake on

Mortal Kombat (SNES/Genesis/Mega Drive) - Blood in the Sega Genesis/Mega Drive version.

Castlevania:Symphony of the Night/Akumajo Dracula X:Gekka no Yasokyoku (Playstation/Sega Saturn/PSP) - Sega Saturn version has two more map areas, with its own exclusive items, enemies, and BGM. Saturn and PSP version have Maria as a playable character, but Maria's move set and controls for Sega Saturn are nearly completely different than what was made for PSP.

Metal Gear (MSX/Famicom/NES) - There is no Metal Gear fight for the Famicom/NES version, only a stand-in gigantic Computer Screen. Famicom/NES version sports a different soundtrack, an intro, and a different infiltration area that lead into Outer Heaven's buildings.

Valis IV (SNES/PC-Engine) - Maybe this one doesn't count, but they are like completely different games, one with more playable characters and cut scenes, and another with just different music and areas, and story.

Simcity (PC/SNES) - SNES Simcity has a fantastic soundtrack, Dr. Wright, bonus building zones and structures, Bowser as a monster attack, and just overall a much more complete and satisfying game.

The Ninja Warriors (Arcade/PC-Engine) - well, the arcade version is played 3-screens wide!
